derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Dutch gingang, from Malay genggang (originally an adjective meaning 'striped')

entry.def: Gingham is cotton cloth which has a woven pattern of small squares, usually in white and one other colour.

means.word_mean: 1. a clothing fabric in a plaid weave
